H0.text: The John Brown Shipyard is/was on which river. Thames

H1.text: The John Brown Shipyard is/was on which river. Mersey

H2.text: The John Brown Shipyard is/was on which river. Tyne

H3.text: The John Brown Shipyard is/was on which river. Clyde

A4.text: Prior to construction commencing on Lusitania in 1904 the shipyard was reorganized to accommodate her so that she could be launched diagonally across the widest available part of the river Clyde where it met a tributary (the River Cart)

A5.text: Clydebank also became Cun Relevant shipbuilder, building its flagship liners RMS Lusitania and RMS Aquitania
